abstract: Wells Fargo said late Wednesday afternoon that it was planning to sell $10 billion in common stock to help fund its purchase of Wachovia, in a deal that would create the fourth-largest American bank in terms of assets.
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo said late Wednesday afternoon that it was planning to sell $10 billion in common stock to help fund its purchase of Wachovia, in a deal that would create the fourth-largest American bank in terms of assets.

headline.main: Wells Fargo to Sell $10 Billion in Stock
